column4: hey there, i've got some problems with my audio on 12.04 w unity. herse the pulseaudio output: http://paste.ubuntu.com/1099333/
are you trying pulseaudio equalizer by any chance?
i hardly vote on anything, only confirming that for me the pulseaudio-equalizer works just fine

for now you seem to have a misconfigured pulseaudio-equalizer, perhaps try to purge it and see if that gets pulseaudio going again if you decide to keep that .. for the record, just a user trying to enjoy audio on ubuntu, not flame-wars about pulseaudio vs alsa etc
from the 3 lines in your pastebin that's hard to tell
it might have been, but that goes for just about anything
usr13 solved one part of it, reinstalled alsa and pulseaudio and added alias snd-card-0 snd-hda-intel options snd-hda-intel model=auto
when running pulseaudio, the same "failed to load module "module-ladspa-sink"" appears
nice (your succes with pulseaudio and inception both) .. when things go wrong that's quite reasonable yes
i asked whether you wanted to pastebin your ~/.pulse/default.pa but you were already gone i believe
so audio-wise all back to normal?
i don't think that you're gonna need the default.pa, right?
not if you ditched pulseaudio-equalizer no
